docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON - President Obama asked Gov. Kathleen Sebelius of Kansas to become his nominee for secretary of health and human services on Saturday, tapping a red-state ally to help him push through his ambitious plan to remake the nation's health care system.

headline.main: Obama Is Said to Pick Kansas Governor for Health Post

docs.abstract: President Obama asked Gov. Kathleen Sebelius of Kansas to become his nominee for secretary of health and human services on Saturday, an administration official said.
docs.snippet: President Obama asked Gov. Kathleen Sebelius of Kansas to become his nominee for secretary of health and human services on Saturday, an administration official said.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former executive of the health care financing company, who was a crucial witness in a $1.9 billion corporate fraud case, was sentenced to two years in prison.

docs.lead_paragraph: This week, Dr. John Mulhall, director of the Male Sexual and Reproductive Medicine Program at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center in New York, has been taking questions on the Well blog about what to expect following treatment for prostate cancer. Today, Dr. Mulhall, author of Saving Your Sex Life: A Guide for Men With Prostate Cancer, answers questions about exploring treatment options, effects of treatment on erectile function and penile rehabilitation after cancer treatments. Next week, Dr. Mulhall will answer questions about testosterone, alternative remedies and implants, and other treatments to restore sexual function.

headline.main: Answers to Your Prostate Cancer Questions

docs.abstract: Dr. John Mulhall, author of "Saving Your Sex Life: A Guide for Men With Prostate Cancer, answers questions.
docs.snippet: Dr. John Mulhall, author of "Saving Your Sex Life: A Guide for Men With Prostate Cancer, answers questions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.

headline.main: The Mounting Price of Health Care's Status Quo

docs.abstract: A defense of the status quo is par for the course in American health policy. If it will once again carry the day in the forthcoming debate on health care reform, then the American people have only themselves to blame for the predictable and severe consequences, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: A defense of the status quo is par for the course in American health policy. If it will once again carry the day in the forthcoming debate on health care reform, then the American people have only themselves to blame for the predictable and severe...

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s budget represents a huge break from policy trends. If he can get it through Congress, he will set America on a fundamentally new course.
